intro: Neurolaena, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Their flowers are showy, with five petals and a prominent central disk, and they produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Neurolaena species are often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas.
